title: Mason Caton-Brown
text:
Mason Caton-Brown (born 24 May 1993) is a former <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played as a er or and represented <a href="Jamaica%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Jamaica</a> at international level.
He has previously played for the <a href="London%20Broncos">London Broncos</a> in the <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a>, and on loan from the <a href="London%20Broncos">Broncos</a> at the <a href="Hemel%20Stags">Hemel Stags</a> in <a href="League%201%20%28rugby%20league%29">League 1</a>. Caton-Brown has also played in the top flight for the <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford Red Devils</a>, and <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a> in two separate spells, and spent time on loan from <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield</a> at the <a href="Dewsbury%20Rams">Dewsbury Rams</a> in the <a href="RFL%20Championship">Championship</a>. He also played for the <a href="Toronto%20Wolfpack">Toronto Wolfpack</a> in the <a href="Betfred%20Championship">Betfred Championship</a>.
He has also represented Jamaica in rugby sevens.
Background.
Caton-Brown was born in <a href="Enfield%20Town">Enfield</a>, <a href="London">London</a>, <a href="England">England</a>. He attended <a href="Enfield%20Grammar%20School">Enfield Grammar School</a> and then went on to be a boarding pupil at <a href="Mill%20Hill%20School">Mill Hill School</a>. Caton-Brown then studied Biochemistry at <a href="Leicester%20University">Leicester University</a>.
He represented England Students at the age of 17; winning against Scotland under-18s and Catalans Dragons under-18s.
Rugby League career.
For the 2013 season, Caton-Brown played for the <a href="Hemel%20Stags">Hemel Stags</a> in the <a href="RFL%20League%201">Championship One</a> after being put on dual registration to the Hemel Stags after impressive performances for the London Broncos Under-19s. He scored 9 tries in 14 appearances for the semi-professional side.
Mason Caton-Brown made his début for the <a href="London%20Broncos">London Broncos</a> on 1 September 2013 against the <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Bulls</a> after impressing (now former) head coach <a href="Tony%20Rea">Tony Rea</a> whilst playing for the <a href="Hemel%20Stags">Hemel Stags</a>. He scored a try on début.
In his second game for the capital side, he scored a hat trick against the <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a> on 8 September 2014.
His started the 2014 Super League season by scoring 2 tries vs the <a href="Widnes%20Vikings">Widnes Vikings</a>. At the <a href="Magic%20Weekend">Magic Weekend</a>, head coach <a href="Joey%20Grima">Joe Grima</a> confirmed that Caton-Brown has attracted many top Super League clubs despite only playing 16 first-grade games for the club (correct on 21 May 2014).
He joined the <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford Red Devils</a>, after being signed on a -year deal from the <a href="London%20Broncos">London Broncos</a>.
He left <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford</a> to join <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a> from the 2017 season.(<a href="List%20of%20Wakefield%20Trinity%20players">Heritage № 1380</a>)
Caton-Brown represented <a href="Jamaica%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Jamaica Rugby League</a> against <a href="England%20Knights">England Knights</a> at the <a href="Headingley%20Rugby%20Stadium">Headingley Rugby Stadium</a> Scoring Jamaica's only try.
In July 2019, Wakefield announced that Caton-Brown had left the club to "pursue other business interests".
Rugby Sevens.
He played for the <a href="Jamaica%20national%20rugby%20sevens%20team">Jamaica national rugby sevens team</a> at the 2019 Hong Kong Sevens qualifier for the World Rugby Sevens Series. He also represented Jamaica at the 2019 Pan American Games.
Business career.
During his rugby career, Caton-Brown built an extensive property portfolio around the North West of England. In 2019 he left <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a> to pursue other "business interests" relating to property development and e-commerce.
